intro: Antirrhinum fragrans, commonly known as the sweetpea, is a flowering plant belonging to the genus Antirrhinum in the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of blooms throughout the summer season. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Antirrhinum fragrans is native to the Mediterranean region and is widely cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant scent.
